intro: Tripleura, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plants are shrubs that typically grow in high-altitude environments with cool, moist climates. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value and hardy nature.
